title: Integrated Disaster and Emergency Management System (IDEMS)
description: Strengthening disaster preparedness and emergency response capabilities in Mumbai through technologically advanced, integrated command and control system.
projectObjective: To strengthen disaster preparedness and enhance emergency response capabilities in Mumbai—India's most densely populated metropolitan area—by implementing a technologically advanced, integrated command and control system.
projectOverview: In response to the growing need for proactive disaster management and real-time emergency coordination, a centralized Integrated Disaster and Emergency Management System (IDEMS) was established in Mumbai. The system spans across 480 sq. km and interlinks 34 emergency response centers, forming a robust, city-wide communication and operations network.

At the heart of the system lies an Enterprise GIS-based Integrated Command and Control System (ICCS), supported by Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) technologies. This allows the system not only to manage live incidents but also to analyze historical data, visualize ongoing situations, and predict future disaster events. Through data fusion and intelligent analysis, the IDEMS enables emergency authorities to make faster, more informed decisions.

title: Enterprise GIS & Network Analysis Solution
description: Modernizing power distribution network across Maharashtra through Enterprise GIS enabling data-driven decision-making and optimized operations.
client: Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL)
projectObjective: To modernize the power distribution network across Maharashtra by implementing an Enterprise GIS and Network Analysis solution, enabling data-driven decision-making, improved load management, and optimized operational planning.
projectOverview: MSEDCL, one of the largest power distribution utilities in India, embarked on a digital transformation initiative to address the complexities of its vast and diverse power infrastructure. The goal was to shift from fragmented and manual processes to a centralized, geospatially intelligent system that could provide real-time visibility, predictive insights, and operational agility.

A comprehensive Enterprise Geographic Information System (GIS) was designed and integrated with advanced network analysis tools and spatial dashboards, enabling accurate modeling of electrical assets, load centers, feeder lines, substations, and consumer distribution points. title: AI-Driven Demand/Load Forecasting System
description: Developing intelligent forecasting platform enabling MSEDCL to predict energy demand with high accuracy for optimal load distribution.
client: Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL)
projectObjective: To develop a robust and intelligent forecasting platform that enables MSEDCL to predict energy demand with high accuracy, supporting optimal load distribution and long-term power planning for Maharashtra's metropolitan and rural areas.
projectOverview: With fluctuating consumption patterns across urban and rural Maharashtra, MSEDCL required a sophisticated forecasting system to ensure reliable electricity supply while minimizing wastage and peak-time overloads. The project focused on building an AI/ML-powered demand/load forecasting platform capable of analyzing real-time and historical data to deliver precise predictions at various granular levels—feeder, substation, division, and zone.

The system was integrated with SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition), GIS, and cloud-based analytics platforms to provide end-to-end automation and actionable insights. By leveraging artificial intelligence, machine learning models, and geospatial intelligence, MSEDCL significantly enhanced its planning capabilities, resulting in cost savings, better resource management, and improved service reliability.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Business Analytics and Demand Forecasting
keyScopeOfWork.description: Developed analytical models to assess historical consumption trends, weather impact, peak load behaviors, and seasonal shifts. Forecasting algorithms were calibrated using both linear regression and deep learning techniques (e.g., LSTM) for short-, medium-, and long-term demand projections. Insights supported decisions on procurement, generation scheduling, and grid readiness.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Power Optimization Solution
keyScopeOfWork.description: Implemented load balancing logic that uses forecasted data to allocate energy resources more efficiently across the network. Reduced overloading on critical infrastructure by identifying demand spikes in advance. Enabled dynamic energy re-routing to ensure uninterrupted supply with minimal transmission losses.

keyScopeOfWork.title: AI and ML-Based Debriefing with Analytics
keyScopeOfWork.description: AI and ML tools provided continuous debriefing on consumption anomalies, deviation from forecasted values, and predictive alerts for sudden demand surges. Dashboards displayed key KPIs like deviation margins, system reliability indices, and grid performance metrics. Automated report generation for decision-makers to monitor real-time and projected scenarios.

keyScopeOfWork.title: GIS-Based Applications Implementation
keyScopeOfWork.description: Integrated spatial intelligence for geo-tagged demand forecasting at different administrative levels (circle, division, sub-division). Provided visual overlays of energy demand zones, enabling focused interventions and planning in high-demand or underserved areas. GIS maps helped correlate external factors (e.g., urban development, population density) with consumption behavior.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Cloud and Data Management Integration
keyScopeOfWork.description: Deployed a scalable cloud infrastructure to handle large volumes of time-series and spatial data. Real-time ingestion from SCADA, metering systems, and consumer databases ensured model freshness and forecasting accuracy. Centralized data lake architecture allowed seamless data sharing, storage, and analytics across departments.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Facility Management Service (FMS) for 5 Years
keyScopeOfWork.description: A dedicated team was appointed for 24x7 system upkeep, software patching, model recalibration, data management, and user training. Regular upgrades and adaptive enhancements were delivered as consumption patterns evolved. SLA-driven operations ensured consistent platform performance and availability.

impact: Up to 20% improvement in forecasting accuracy

title: National Landslide Forecasting System
description: Designing nationwide technology-driven early warning system for landslides leveraging GIS, meteorological data, and ICT infrastructure.
client: Geological Survey of India (GSI), Ministry of Mines
projectObjective: To design and operationalize a nationwide, technology-driven early warning system for landslides, leveraging GIS, meteorological data, and ICT infrastructure to improve forecasting accuracy, mitigate disaster risks, and protect lives and infrastructure across vulnerable regions in India.
projectOverview: Landslides pose a persistent threat to various parts of India, particularly in hilly and mountainous regions such as the Himalayas, Western Ghats, and Northeast India. To address this, the Geological Survey of India (GSI) initiated a transformative project aimed at establishing a 24x7 National Landslide Forecasting Centre based in Kolkata.

The system leverages Enterprise GIS, meteorological modeling, and advanced data analytics to forecast landslide events with greater precision. It consolidates multi-source data, such as real-time rainfall, soil saturation levels, terrain attributes, and historical landslide events, into a centralized ICT platform that powers predictive analysis and geospatial visualization. This initiative significantly enhances India's capability to issue early warnings, implement mitigation strategies, and improve readiness in disaster-prone regions.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Enterprise GIS Platform Deployment
keyScopeOfWork.description: Developed a scalable, cloud-compatible GIS platform tailored for national-level geospatial analysis. Supported the creation of detailed vulnerability maps based on slope instability, geological formations, land use, and rainfall patterns. Enabled layering of historical landslide data, satellite imagery, and real-time field reports.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Secure and Redundant Data Centre Setup
keyScopeOfWork.description: Built a high-availability data center with disaster recovery and fault-tolerant infrastructure. Ensured uninterrupted data flow and system uptime through redundant power supply, HVAC, and failover configurations. Compliance with national data security standards to safeguard sensitive geospatial and meteorological data.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Middleware for Seamless System Integration
keyScopeOfWork.description: Implemented a robust middleware layer for the integration of multiple data sources, including IMD weather data, WMS/WFS feeds, remote sensors, and third-party forecasting APIs. Standardized data formats and protocols for smooth interoperability between forecasting models and visualization platforms.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Interactive Map-Centric Dashboards
keyScopeOfWork.description: Designed web-based dashboards offering dynamic, map-based visualization of potential landslide zones. Provided users with filtering capabilities (location, intensity, time window) and real-time status indicators. Dashboards catered to both expert users (scientists, analysts) and decision-makers (disaster response officials).

keyScopeOfWork.title: ICT Infrastructure for Rainfall Forecasting Integration
keyScopeOfWork.description: Integrated Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) forecasts and ground station data for rainfall intensity and duration. Rainfall threshold models were applied to simulate slope saturation and landslide probability. Enabled early alerts when forecasted rainfall exceeded critical thresholds in susceptible regions.

keyScopeOfWork.title: 24x7 National Forecasting Centre
keyScopeOfWork.description: Established an always-on command and coordination hub staffed with trained analysts, GIS specialists, and IT operators. Provided real-time monitoring, model execution, and stakeholder communication round-the-clock. Linked with State Disaster Management Authorities (SDMAs) and local administrations for ground-level action.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Data Integration Capabilities
keyScopeOfWork.description: Real-time data feeds from AWS (Automatic Weather Stations), field sensors, and historical landslide databases were fused to power machine learning algorithms. Enabled continuous model recalibration and event validation through field data ingestion.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Smart Decision Support Tools
keyScopeOfWork.description: Delivered analytical tools for scenario simulation, resource planning, and impact assessment. Helped stakeholders make informed decisions regarding evacuation plans, infrastructure protection, and deployment of emergency services.

impact: Timely and location-specific landslide alerts
Better preparedness and resource mobilization
Scientific modeling and risk mapping guidance

title: Distributed Security Operations Centre (DSOC)
description: Fortifying Indian Air Force's digital infrastructure through distributed SOCs for real-time threat detection and cyber incident response.
projectObjective: To fortify the Indian Air Force's digital infrastructure through the implementation of distributed Security Operations Centres (DSOCs) capable of real-time threat detection, cyber incident response, and continuous security monitoring, in alignment with national defense protocols.
projectOverview: With escalating threats in the cyber domain targeting defense systems, the Indian Air Force (IAF) commissioned the establishment of interconnected, on-premise Security Operations Centres across five high-priority locations. These DSOCs were designed to operate independently but communicate seamlessly for centralized threat intelligence sharing, policy enforcement, and coordinated response actions.

Each DSOC was built using robust cybersecurity tools such as Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) platforms, AI-powered analytics, and digital forensics solutions. The infrastructure provides proactive monitoring, behavior anomaly detection, real-time alerting, and automated incident triaging to ensure mission-critical systems remain uncompromised.

keyScopeOfWork.title: On-Premise SOC Setup

Included infrastructure for NOC/SOC integration, monitoring workstations, and incident response teams.

keyScopeOfWork.title: SIEM Tool Deployment
keyScopeOfWork.description: Deployed a highly scalable SIEM platform capable of ingesting logs and telemetry from endpoint devices, servers, communication systems, and network assets. Configured use cases specific to defense protocols, including unauthorized access, port scanning, privilege escalation attempts, and exfiltration behaviors.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Threat Intelligence Platform Integration
keyScopeOfWork.description: Set up real-time feeds from threat intelligence sources, national CERT advisories, and global defense-grade databases. Enabled contextual enrichment of events to prioritize high-risk indicators of compromise (IOCs).

keyScopeOfWork.title: Advanced Analytics and Response Capabilities
keyScopeOfWork.description: Implemented AI/ML models to detect behavioral anomalies and zero-day threats. Integrated forensic toolkits for incident investigation, digital evidence preservation, and compliance reporting. Provided automated playbooks for rapid containment, including endpoint isolation and access revocation.

impact: 24/7 cyber surveillance across critical air defense assets
Reduced mean-time-to-detect and respond to threats
Improved national cybersecurity posture
Enabled secure collaboration across bases

title: Security Operations Centre (SOC) - PGCIL
description: Establishing secure cybersecurity monitoring framework for India's largest power transmission network across 350+ sites.
client: Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (PGCIL)
projectObjective: To establish a secure and resilient cybersecurity monitoring framework for India's largest power transmission network, ensuring uninterrupted operations and protection from advanced persistent threats (APTs).
projectOverview: PGCIL operates a complex network of substations, control centers, and communication systems, vital to India's power grid stability. Recognizing the criticality of this infrastructure, a centralized and distributed Security Operations Centre (SOC) was deployed to secure more than 350+ geographically distributed sites connected via air-gapped and segmented networks.

The solution included SIEM for log correlation and threat detection, SOAR (Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response) for incident automation, and forensic tools for deep-dive investigations. The SOC ensures real-time visibility across heterogeneous environments while maintaining strict compliance with critical infrastructure protection guidelines.

title: Maha-Mantralaya Security Operation Centre
description: Centralized SOC for Government of Maharashtra ensuring round-the-clock cybersecurity monitoring and threat detection across 30+ departments.
client: Department of Information Technology (DIT), Government of Maharashtra
projectObjective: To design, build, and operate a centralized Security Operation Centre (SOC) for the Government of Maharashtra, ensuring round-the-clock cybersecurity monitoring, proactive threat detection, and response capabilities for over 30 integrated state departments.
projectOverview: With the increasing digitization of government services and the growing cyber threat landscape, the Government of Maharashtra required a unified cybersecurity backbone capable of protecting sensitive citizen data, digital governance platforms, and critical applications across departments.

The Department of Information Technology (DIT) partnered to establish a full-fledged, multi-tier Security Operation Centre (SOC) at the heart of Mantralaya. This SOC acts as the nerve center for cyber defense, covering a wide array of connected government bodies such as Finance, Revenue, Urban Development, Home, and more. The system enables 24/7 surveillance and threat mitigation using an integrated SIEM platform, advanced vulnerability assessment tools, a skilled analyst hierarchy (L1–L3), and standard operating procedures (SOPs) for incident handling.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Complete SOC Design & Deployment
keyScopeOfWork.description: Developed a high-availability, defense-in-depth SOC environment with secure zoning, physical access controls, and redundancy. keyScopeOfWork.title: SIEM Integration with 30+ Log Sources
keyScopeOfWork.description: Deployed and fine-tuned a next-generation Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) platform. Integrated more than 30 critical log sources, including firewalls, endpoint security, email gateways, Active Directory, application logs, and web servers. Created correlation rules to identify policy violations, data exfiltration attempts, account compromises, and malware activities.

keyScopeOfWork.title: Vulnerability Management & Asset Discovery

keyScopeOfWork.title: Use Case & SOP Development

keyScopeOfWork.title: Tiered Analyst Model Deployment (L1-L3)
keyScopeOfWork.description: Established a layered SOC operation structure with L1 (alert monitoring), L2 (incident validation and investigation), and L3 (threat hunting and response) roles. keyScopeOfWork.title: Unified Government Department Security Framework
keyScopeOfWork.description: Created a centralized cybersecurity governance framework for all integrated departments. Standardized policies, incident management workflows, and reporting formats. Enabled cross-departmental visibility and collaboration for state-wide threat management.

keyScopeOfWork.title: SOC Staffing & Skill Transfer (5 Years)
keyScopeOfWork.description: Deployed trained cybersecurity professionals for operational roles across the SOC. Conducted regular training, knowledge transfer, and capacity-building workshops for in-house government IT teams. Ensured self-reliance and operational continuity post-handover.

impact: 24/7 threat detection across 30+ government departments

Rapid containment of cyber incidents

Built resilient cybersecurity foundation for digital transformation

title: Central Electricity Inspectorate Division - Centralized Monitoring System

title: CRIS - IT Infrastructure for Ticket Management

projectObjective: To modernize Indian Railways' field ticketing operations through a robust, mobile-first digital infrastructure for real-time issuance and tracking.

These tablets enabled on-the-spot ticket issuance, passenger verification, and seamless synchronization with central ticketing databases. Supporting this rollout, a Mobile Device Management (MDM) platform ensured centralized control, security, and device health monitoring.

title: Cancer Institute - Cisco Networking Stack
